page.title: 13SHEEP SHEARING,Yeoford.
page.content: At{Shortacombe Farm}we went to watch the sheep shearing.We got the sheep in early ready for the sheep shearer, we put the sheep into a bullock shed.We put some sheep into a separate pen and they were the ones that were going to be sheared first. The farmer and his brother took it in turns to catch the sheep for the sheep shearer who lives at{Woodland Head.}When they caught the sheep,he held the sheep by its knees. He started from the tummy and worked from there downwards, he then did the sheep's legs, then he did one of the sheep's sides, then the back and other side.It was then marked with a "C" for the farmer. All the fleeces were rolled up and put in a pile and then when there was time the fleeces would be taken to the wool factory in North Tawton. We then took the sheep back to the field.
